title: Dispatch Had A Strong Showing On PlayStation's Top Games For November 2025
description: GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.                It might be too soon to say that Telltale Games-style...
body:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
                It might be too soon to say that Telltale Games-style adventures are getting a comeback, but Dispatch came out swinging against some of the top-selling games last month and came in third in PlayStation Store's top PlayStation 5 games for November in the United States and Canada.Sony has shared its PSN charts for the top games in North America and the European Union in November. and there was a clear winner on both lists--Call of Duty: Black Ops 7. Arc Raiders came in behind at No. 2, followed by Dispatch at No. 3, Battlefield 6 at No. 4, and NBA 2K26 rounding out the top 5 for the US.Among PlayStation 4 games, Red Dead Redemption 2 kept a firm grasp on both European and North American gamers. But that was about the only direct area of agreement they had this month. Although many of the titles on both lists were the same, the order was drastically different aside from the top slot.Alien: Rogue Incursion VR topped both charts for the top 10 VR2 games, although the selection has been lacking in that category for some time. It wasn't until the free-to-play games that North American and European tastes diverged for the top slot. American and Canadian gamers favored Where Winds Meet, while Europeans chose Battlefield Redsec.You can find the full breakdown of PlayStation's top games for November 2025 in North America and Europe below.

title: Cult Of The Lamb Brings Sects And Violence To iOS Today
description: By     Darryn Bonthuys   on December 4, 2025 at 11:16AM PST                                GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from...
body:
By 
    Darryn Bonthuys
   on December 4, 2025 at 11:16AM PST    
          
                  GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
                Apple Arcade subscribers can look forward to an eclectic selection of new games today, as ninja action, sects education, and a trip to Bikini Bottom have all been added to the service. The main event game this month is Cult of the Lamb, a delightful blend of roguelike dungeon-crawling and base-building.If you haven't tried it out yet, Apple Arcade is a subscription program similar to Xbox Game Pass. It costs $7 per month and offers 200+ licensed and original games to play on iPhone, iPad, Mac, Apple TV, and Apple Vision Pro. You can try it out for free for one month, and if you've purchased a new Apple device, you'll receive three months of Apple Arcade for free.Cult of the Lamb: Arcade EditionA critically acclaimed game since it first launched in 2022, Cult of the Lamb: Arcade Edition includes every major update and DLC expansion released to date, as well as new follower forms and base decorations that will be exclusive to the iOS version of the game. If you haven't played it, Cult of the Lamb is a deceptively cute roguelike, where you take on the role of an adorable lamb that has been sacrificed to dark gods and resurrected by an outcast deity. As its herald, it's up to you to build a new following for your master, grow your power, and sacrifice the occasional follower in a dark ceremony.Glassbreakers: Champions of MossIn case you missed it, real-time action strategy game Glassbreakers: Champions of Moss launched on November 13 for Apple Vision Pro and is now in the Apple Arcade library. SpongeBob: Patty Pursuit 2Another highlight this month is SpongeBob: Patty Pursuit 2, as the lovable Krusty Krab frycook has to team up with the devious Plankton to save Bikini Bottom. The duo will have to work together to recover the Krusty Krab's missing fry cook station and locate Planktonâ€™s mysteriously vanished inventions.PowerWash SimulatorApple Arcade subscribers can pick up a high-pressure cleaner for some zen-like fun in PowerWash Simulator. The game has a simple premise, as you're tasked with completing various dirty jobs around town with your trusty cleaning equipment. The Apple Arcade version of the game has been optimized with touch controls and gyroscope support to make the art of high-pressure water-cleaning feel seamless on iOS devices, and players can also take on additional post-launch jobs like cleaning up SpongeBob's pineapple home. Naruto: Ultimate Ninja Storm+Naruto: Ultimate Ninja Storm+ brings the cult-classic 3D fighting game series to iOS. The game retells pivotal moments from Naruto's early storyline, and several new features have been added to make the game easier to play on mobile devices. Subway SurfersIf you need something that you can play on autopilot, you can grab Subway Surfers for some endless running distractions.

title: Amazon Prime Members Get These 14 Free Games In December
description: GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.                                              It's the last month of the...
body:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
  
    
              
          
                It's the last month of the year, and Amazon is closing out 2025 with 14 free games for Prime Gaming members. One of the big highlights this month is Lego 2K Drive, an open-world racing game that emphasizes car customization with each unlockable Lego ride. The new season of Fallout debuts on Prime Video later this month, and you can check out the classic games that inspired it, starting December 23.Deus Ex fans can jump into Mankind Divided for a slow-burning sci-fi thriller, while those looking for a more mythical adventure can explore a world of legend in Bo: Path of the Teal Lotus, a colorful hand-drawn adventure inspired by Japanese folklore. After facing an uphill battle since launch, Bo: Path of the Teal Lotus just received its first major update, making it a great time to give the game a try.As a reminder, all of the free games that you claim through Prime Gaming are yours to keep forever, even if your subscription expires. If you aren't a member yet, you can sign up for Amazon Prime for as little as one month to take advantage of the subscription and its freebies.Prime Gaming free games for December 2025Now availableLego 2K Drive (Epic Games Store)Forgotten Realms: The Archives - Collection One (GOG)GYLT (Amazon Games App)December 11Forgotten Realms: The Archives - Collection Two (GOG)Christmas Adventure: Candy Storm (Legacy Games Code)December 18Gun Slugs 2 (GOG)Ashworld (GOG)Forgotten Realms: The Archives - Collection Three (GOG)Bo: Path of the Teal Lotus (GOG)December 23Fallout (GOG)Fallout 2 (GOG)December 30Dreamscaper (Epic Games Store)Living Legends: The Crystal Tears - Collector's Edition (Amazon Games App)Deus Ex: mankind Divided (Epic Games Store)Prime subscribers will also be able to play the following new games in December via the Prime Gaming Luna channel:Goat Simulator 3The Smurfs: Village PartyShip of FoolsFallout 4: Game of the Year EditionShadow of the Tomb Raider: Definitive EditionTiny Tina's WonderlandsGuacamelee 2: Complete EditionLego Pirates of the Caribbean: The Video GameMafia: Definitive EditionBee SimulatorRide 4Hot Wheels UnleashedDredgeHollow Knight
